data.title: A Pretty Small Museum That  Is Rather Limited--  But It's FREE
data.text:
This history museum is located at 410 N Main Avenue, Gresham, Oregon 97030. It is located inside an old library. In fact it was the original Gresham Library, the Carnegie Library. It looks very distinctive. An English Tutor style building from 1912.
The building is on the US National Register of Historic Places.
The museum is run by the Gresham Historical Society. 

The museum is free to the public.

They change their exhibits on a biannual basis.Displaying different aspects of Gresham history and artifacts. Today they had a new display featuring fireman and policemen that was on the south side of the building. This wasn't really of much interest to me. But that is just the half of it. There was still more to check out.

Over on the north side they had the Jazz festival as the main focus. This festival is no longer held in Gresham. I used to be the Mount Hood Jazz festival. They had artwork of some of the years of the jazz festival as well as photograph of some of the performers that played. The first face that I recognized immediately was TONY BENNET. For me this half of the room was the highlight. I had totally forgotten about the old festival and the sure had some mighty good photos to promote each year of the festival.

One of their rules is that you can't take photography inside the museum. I guess that is so that what is inside remains a surprise for visitors.

The Hours they are open is rather limited:
Tuesdays and Thursdays 10 AM to 4 PM
Fridays 2 PM to 8 PM
Saturdays 10 AM to 2 PM

data.title: Small but interesting
data.text: The museum is in the pretty old Gresham library building. It's tiny, but fun to walk through, and I learned new things. I appreciated that they did not censor Gresham's history, but presented the bad alongside the good.

data.title: Little big town
data.text: Love this place. I just happened in and was met by a long time Gresham resident who made the time for a personal tour. I especially liked the old gas pump and how local residents get involved. Take notice of the Bronz piece in the front yard also. Than have lunch next door at what used to be a beautiful old church where I married my wife. It is called Spinella's  and they have done a great respectful job with it. Music and food.

data.title: Neat area history..............
data.text: Although the hours are limited this little piece of east county offers some interesting history.  Love the pictures and the building. Easy walk through and educational.

data.title: On the National Register of Historical Places
data.text:
My husband and I found out there was a historical walking tour in Gresham and it started at this museum. On the stairs of this museum, the guild told us that this building, (built in 1913) was one of 25 out of  31 public library's in Oregon that was built with a construction grant paid by Andrew Carnegie, (a philanthropist).  We have the Tudor style, which is much different than most of these public library's. T
The library closed it's doors in 1989, and was added to the national register of historical places in 2000, and in 2012 opened it's doors once again to serve as our Pioneer Museum.
Since this tour, we have taken some of our grand children here, to see things they have not  seen anywhere else.

data.title: Anything historical to me is great.
data.text: Unless you are from here, I don't think it would thrill a visitor. It's about the history of this area. It's close to the river, and the train. NOt all people are into that kind of thing.
